title: Garden Vocabulary
description: Test your knowledge of gardening and botanical terms — from 'perennial' to 'topiary' and everything in between!

questions.question: What is a 'perennial' plant?
options: A plant that dies after one season
A plant that lives for more than two years and blooms repeatedly
A plant that only grows in spring

questions.question: What does 'topiary' refer to?
options: The art of clipping shrubs into ornamental shapes

questions.question: What is 'mulch' used for in gardening?
options: Covering soil to retain moisture and suppress weeds

questions.question: What does 'germination' mean?
options: The process of a seed beginning to sprout and grow

questions.question: What is an 'annual' plant?
options: A plant that completes its life cycle in one growing season
A plant that only blooms once every ten years
A plant found in yearly gardening magazines

questions.question: What does 'deadheading' mean in gardening?
options: Removing spent flowers to encourage new blooms

questions.question: What is a 'trellis'?
options: A framework structure for climbing plants to grow on

questions.question: What does 'propagation' mean in gardening?
options: The process of growing new plants from seeds, cuttings, or other methods

questions.question: What is 'compost'?
options: Decomposed organic matter used to enrich soil

questions.question: What does 'hardiness zone' refer to?
options: The toughest part of a garden
A geographic area defined by climate conditions indicating which plants will thrive
A zone in the garden for hard soil

questions.question: What is 'espalier'?
options: The technique of training trees to grow flat against a wall or support

questions.question: What does 'bolting' mean when a plant bolts?
options: The plant prematurely produces flowers and seeds, usually due to heat
The plant is secured to a stake

questions.question: What is a 'tuber' in gardening?
options: A thickened underground stem that stores nutrients, like a potato

questions.question: What does 'succession planting' mean?
options: Planting crops at intervals so they mature at different times for a continuous harvest
Planting the same crop every year

questions.question: What is a 'rhizome'?
options: A horizontal underground stem that sends out roots and shoots from its nodes
